pullRequest.title: [Exam] Test Run follow-up
pullRequest.bodyText:
Checklist

 I tested all changes and all related features with different users (student, tutor, instructor, admin) on the test server https://artemistest.ase.in.tum.de.
 Server: I added @PreAuthorize and check the course groups for all new REST Calls (security)
 Server: I implemented the changes with a good performance and prevented too many database calls
 Server: I documented the Java code using JavaDoc style.
 Client: I added multiple integration tests (Jest) related to the features (with a high test coverage)
 Client: I documented the TypeScript code using JSDoc style.
 Client: I added multiple screenshots/screencasts of my UI changes
 Client: I translated all the newly inserted strings into German and English

Motivation and Context
As a follow-up to #2096 this PR addresses:

REST API: Change names of rest call for delete & create test run
Currently, the test run exercises are ordered by the id of the exercise groups. They should follow the order of the exercises groups, as configured for the exam.
Empty exercise groups do not allow the creation of test runs. They should be ignored when creating a test run.
Reduce Code duplication
Improve the performance, complexity and readability of studentExamService.deleteTestRun()

Model Changes:

Add started_date to student_exam. This should be set only when the student first starts the exam conduction.
Change last_modified_date, created_date and submission_date datatype of student_exam to TIMESTAMP
Change last_modified_date created_date datatype of exam_session to TIMESTAMP

Description

Change Routes to:


DELETE courses/{courseId}/exams/{examId}/test-run/{testRunId}
POST courses/{courseId}/exams/{examId}/test-run/


Lock the create test run button if no exercises are found
Ignore exercise groups with no exercises in the test run modal
Keep the order of the exercise groups for the test runs
Refactor the deleteTestRun() to reduce complexity and improve performance


Fetch only relevant exercise participations (no need to filter after)


Improve the client test and server test coverage

Steps for Testing

Log in to Artemis
Create an exam with 2 exercise groups and no exercises
Navigate to the test runs, you should see the locked button and the tooltip for Create Test Run
Add an exercise to one of the exercise groups
Navigate to the test runs, create a test run with one exercise.
Start the test run and finish it
Add an exercise to the other exercise group
Change the order of the exercise groups
Create a new test run.
Check the order of the exercises, it should follow the order set for the exercise groups

Test Coverage
Client:

create-test-run-modal.component.ts 64% -> 70.59%
test-run-management.component.ts 77% -> 79.03%

Server:

StudentExamService: 75% -> 82%

Screenshots
Added Tooltips when disabling buttons:

commit.message:
Maintain the exercise Group order for test runs
Ignore empty exercise groups

Model Changes:
Change last_modified_date, created_date & submission_date to TIMESTAMP for exam session & student exams.
Add started_date to student exams. Set this value initially, when the user first starts the student exam.

Improve performance and code readability of delete test run.
Fix typos and pre authorize

add tooltip when buttons are disabled.
fix translations
fix rest routes and move test run integration tests to StudentExamIntegrationTest
Merge branch 'feature/exam/test-run-follow-up' of github.com:ls1intum/Artemis into feature/exam/test-run-follow-up
improve delete test run tests & coverage

nodes.bodyText:
Could be shortened: return this.exam.exerciseGroups && this.exam.exerciseGroups.some(exerciseGroup => exerciseGroup.exercises && exerciseGroup.exercises.length >  0)
IMO this would be more readable

commit.message:
refactor code to make it more readable
remove unused import
Merge branch 'feature/exam/test-run-follow-up' of github.com:ls1intum/Artemis into feature/exam/test-run-follow-up

nodes.bodyText: typo: Keiner deiner Testläufe ist beendet
nodes.diffHunk: @@ -204,10 +204,12 @@ "title": "Testlaufverwaltung: ", "setup": "Testlauf Erstellen", "author": "Autor*in", - "setupHint": "Wähle für jede Übungsgruppe eine Übung aus, indem du auf die Übung klickst.\nHinweis: Wenn du bereits einen Testlauf mit einer der Übungen erstellt hast, dann wird diese bereits eine Abgabe und Ergebnis haben.", + "setupHint": "Wähle für jede Aufgabengruppe eine Aufgabe aus, indem du auf die Aufgabe klickst.\nHinweis: Wenn du bereits einen Testlauf mit einer der Aufgaben erstellt hast, dann wird diese bereits eine Abgabe und Ergebnis enthalten.", "assess": "Deine Testläufe Bewerten", "manage": "Arbeitszeit verwalten", "text": "Hier kannst du einen Testlauf für die Klausur erstellen. Wähle aus, welche Aufgaben die Klausur enthalten soll und führe sie aus. Anschliessend, kannst du die Abgabe als Tutor bewerten. Das Ergebnis, kann du als Student einsehen und dich Beschweren. Diese Beschwerden kannst du dann als Tutor bewerten.\nHinweis: Abgaben innerhalb von testläufen werden nicht für die Prüfungsergebnisse gezählt.", + "createTestRunDisabled": "Keine Aufgaben gefunden", + "assessTestRunDisabled": "Keins deiner Testläufe ist beended",
